title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: Hello, I have a pro A1708 that's unresponsive, the fan spins for a few seconds if I disconnect and connect the battery and the Amp pull keeps going up gradually 0.8-3.0, it seems dead but the trackpad vibrates when touch, 13v present on L7030, both 'CD3215COO' as well as the SSD get warm after a good few minutes. Any help would be appreciated, Thanks in advance.

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: forgot to mention it pulls 19.83V and 0.265A with just the board connected to power supply and everything else disconnected and there is a tiny water damage sign like a little drop between R8401-R8402

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
Do you get L7210/20 voltage?
If yes, check for USB activity and external video.

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
hi @
[B][USER=682]2informaticos[/USER] n[/B]o I have 0.250 on L7210

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: Post voltage for the other big coils...

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
Post resistance to ground at L7370 (ohm scale).
Also check R/C7379 and R7376.
If all OK, try known good BIOS...

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
resistance to ground at L7370 >  5.73-77 OHMS
R7379 resistance>>11.3 Mili ohms, will try a known good bios and update you

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: hi, the bios did not help its still the same, l7370 resistance is about 11+ohms now

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
L7370 voltage must appear before L7210/20.
But all of them are controlled by same chip, U7100.
These voltages depends by BIOS, U7100 and PCH/CPU.
Very likely bad CPU.

Did you test the board alone on the desk?
No SSD, nor LCD, or other devices; only charger connetced.

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: yes its the same thing with everything disconnected

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: I have similar issue with another A1708 same board number, only one USB-C port was working, I replaced the port and now it does the same thing, Fan runs once when I reconnect the battery and the CPU and SSD warm up a bit but no display at all

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
Stop considering the video as the only life sign.
Always check final CPU core voltage on these A1708 boards.
Also USB activity is a must check ALWAYS.

About the second board, if was working before touching USB-C area, CPU core voltage appears now?
I suppose something was affected by the heat applied on that board...

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: what components do I check CPU core voltage on?

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
L7210/20 in this case.
Check on the output pin, where the filter caps are placed.

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: CPU V core is 0v even on the other board (L7030 has 12.5V though)

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message: I have Re Flashed the BIOS, it is still the same

title: Macbook Pro A1708 (820-00840-A) Random Death
message:
Board can't boot without CPU core voltage.
Check voltage on other big coils; of the second board.

For the future, open separate thread for different boards; even if the same models.
